Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Tower23 this past week. We stayed in a "surf-pad" which is a deal for such a generously-sized direct oceanfront room. It truly is a swanky place to stay -- nothing else like it in the San Diego area -- very sleek and minimalist decor, but elegant at the same time. We've been up and down the California coast and stayed at places that cost as much or more, but dollar for dollar, this is the best hotel. The hotel's restaurant, JRDN, was superb -- dined there twice and recommend eating outdoors by candlelight. The hotel staff was very professional and courteous. The only con is that the Pacific Beach area can at times be somewhat rowdy (but not unsafe). Will definitely stay there again when we visit San Diego and highly recommend to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Retro-class in Dan Diego”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustTour
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel in the Mission Bay area. It had a cool, retro-vibe, but with all the 21st c. bells and whistles. The service was impeccable and the restaurant (JRDN) served up delicious food. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Excellent Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tower 23 as a part of our honeymoon from 13th - 18th April 2012. Upon arrival the Hotel provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne which was very thoughtful and it was a nice touch that they recognized our honeymoon celebrations with this gesture. The room was 212 a 'skypad', which overlooked the upper courtyard with a sea view. The room was very clean and very spacious. The highlight of the room was the large tempur bed, we have both never had as good a night sleep as we had throughout our stay here. The hotel location is fantastic, right on the beach and close by to local transport, restaurants and bars. The area is relaxed and chilled a perfect place for long walks up the beach and a good base to travel to the city centre and also nearby La Jolla (a tip that we learnt is to pay for an all day bus pass at $5.00 each, with this you can travel all day on the buses and the No 30 takes you straight into the city centre and also the opposite way to La Jolla, a taxi to the city costs approx $30.00 each way so a massive saving if you want to travel a lot during your stay. The bus stop is also very close to the hotel). The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. We were travelling to San Francisco after here and the hotel staff (Alyson and Vinnie) pre-booked our Alcatraz tickets for us, which sell out fast. This level of guest service is excellent and we thank them for going this extra way to alleviate the requirement for us to book this so we could concentrate on enjoying our holiday. We loved our stay here and loved our stay in San Diego, the American people were very friendly, from waiters in diners to bus drivers to our hotel staff, we would definitely consider going back to San Diego in the future and if we did we would be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Wholesome,Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: ellegirl727
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tower 23 is newly built and its very clean. Every room has a Large walk out patio. Its a good hotel as a couple,family,or weekend getaway with girlfriends. There's no hidden charges and hotel staff is super friendly. They actually picked up some burritos at the local restaurant because we were too exhausted to look for one and had no idea where to go. beds were very clean the bathroom was posh and modern decor.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & happening ... Great Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoastvisitors
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay! I stayed for five days and Appreciated the service, the following staff went above and beyond making sure that we had coffee, beach chairs, reservations at restaurants and everything else that we needed. I thank the following: Brittany, Tatiana, Phillip, Saray, Ryan, Jeremiah & Danny for fabulous hotel service. And Juan and Eric for great service in the bar/restaurant. We had the grass fed rib eye 16oz and it melted in your mouth! We shared it and it was plenty for two. We also enjoyed the chefs version of a clams casino for an appetizer and the butter salad. The presentation of all the dishes was excellent. The only negative I would say is that it took a while for the showers to heat up and the air conditioner fluctuated when it wanted to work and not. The greatness of the hotel was its excellent service, it made everyone feel like they were important, and it's location right on the pacific ocean. Would highly recommend. A unique modern botique hotel! Look foward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Soothe your soul after a long day at SeaWorld.”
Reviews.Author: TEDtours
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 provides refreshing respite for parents on a SD Zoo / SeaWorld holiday. Outstanding food and service in the restaurant, applies to kids menu as well. Fantastic value for the cost of room and food. Serene, clean design; can’t beat location on the ocean. We were missing Tower 23 and JRDN for days after we left!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break with my kids!”
Reviews.Author: SfromColoradoArvada
Reviews.Content: Our very first trip to San Diego and we had a great time!!! San Diego was amazing and staying at this hotel made it even better! The staff was great! They were very attentive and friendly. I would book this hotel for an adult only trip as I felt the non-locking, semi see through bathroom doors were a bit challenging. The location was awesome...the beach was right by the hotel! The second floor with the fire pit was great and had an amazing view but don't expect some of the guests to care if u were with small children as they don't seem to care about adult language in front of them! I would definietly go back without my 7 year old. This was an awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, we'll recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre_TF
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed the hotel: nice design, good rooms, very good customer service, great bar very entertaining and good food. My only disappointment was that the oysters were not very tasty (although very fresh), all the rest was very good and people was very helpful and educated. Going to the Tower 23 is the guarantee to have a high level service in a design hotel, and enjoy an authentic local atmosphere at the bar and restaurant at a very decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erchla
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. Nice, clean rooms and bathroom. Very spacious. Great location - we did a lot of time in La Jolla while staying here. Only complaint we had was the lack of a coffee maker in the room. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: supertofu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last week. We had very high expectations of this place due to all of the good reviews we read. I must say it lives up to its expectations. Excellent customer service, beautiful rooms, great location. I wish we had upgraded to the surf pad. The views are worth it. The only issue we had was the room above us sounded like they were racing elephants, but luckily that subsided before we got annoyed. The area gets quite busy with tourists so you will hear street noise. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy-cool Place in Funky Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: RonK_LA
Reviews.Content: Tower23 opened around six years ago about 10 miles north of San Diego. It's located in Pacific Beach and either you will love the its edgy-funkiness (like Venice, California 20 years ago) or you will wonder what a sexy-cool hotel is doing in a neighborhood like this. If you have a large sense of entitlement, and seeing some grit and edge will just ruin your martini or G and T, do yourself a favor and stay in La Jolla just up the road. In PB, you are far more likely to score a tattoo than a designer boutique. That said, the hotel is a modern minimalist gem. All glass and white walls. A video loop of surfers plays endlessly on a small monitor the unpretentious lobby. The action here is in the Bar/Restaurant JRDN (pronounced a little surprisingly "Jordan", not "jardin.") Serving mostly very good food and a lively scene, it's particularly packed on weekends when the weather is good. The other great space is the Tower Deck on the second floor where white-towel covered lounge chairs surround something resembling a wading pool. I think it's six inches deep and I have never seen anyone so much as put their foot in there, so, hey, maybe it's just a water element or something. Nomenclature aside, it's a great place for a hang or a tan or to watch the joggers, surfers, runners and homeless people walk, run, or waddle by. The rooms are clean and uber-minimalist, almost sterile if it were not for the drop-dead views. I recently stayed in a Sanctuary Suite and loved the extra space and the jacuzzi tub looking out over the crashing waves of the Pacific. The bathroom also sports a small sink, a stand-alone shower and small slightly depressing room with a toilet. I am hoping it's fluorescent lighting is a green gesture and not a design choice. Yikes. Most if not all of the rooms have terraces on which you can see and/or hear the crashing of the Pacific. With "art" like that, who needs art in the rooms? This is not a place you come for white glove service, but the staff is young, attractive and happy to be helping you in any way they can. They try really hard, but sometimes you can really feel them trying and the strain shows. Bottom Line: This property is my first choice when I come to San Diego for any reason, business or pleasure. It's perfect for a romantic weekend, or whenever you want to get-away from it all. A recent four-day stay undid months of work/life stress. And if it worked for me, it might just work for you. Give it a try, I don't think you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, right on the beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: cday1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 2012 off a deal we got on Bloomspot. The room was very nice and clean and we had a view of the ocean. It's in walking distance to many restaurants and the boardwalk. We sat on the deck on watched a beautiful sunset while having coctails, but never had a chance to eat at the restaurant. I hear it's really good! We would definitely stay here again. It's a very nice boutique hotel! The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is because of the price of parking, but that's a given pretty much in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: onabeachinkona
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tower last October and coming up on a stay in April. The Surf Pad has an amazing view. The staff will bend over backwards for you. The food is excellant. The location is stunning. This is THE place to take someone special and forget about work, traffic and the hectic life you lead. Just enjoy a drink watching the sun drop beyond the horizon with the pier in view, people watch as they drift by on the sidewalk. A truly amazing package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel53705
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five nights at Tower23 on a "girlfriends get away" trip to California. We stayed in a "Sky Pad" with two queen beds. The hotel is very modern with a laid back "beachy" attitude, so if you're looking for traditional or posh/luxury accomodations, this isn't it. The staff at the front desk were friendly, helpful and prompt. We asked them for recommendations on several occassions and their advice was useful. The good: The beds/linens/pillows are very comfortable. Some rooms have direct access from the room to the terrace on the 2nd floor overlooking the beach and boardwalk. It's a great place to people watch, relax and read, or just share a drink while watching the waves. The location of the hotel is close to restaurants (Kronos is great for breakfast!), bike rentals, and the beach. We didn't need a rental car. The not-so-good (these are minor in my opinion): It's a popular spot for going out so the bar is always full--day & night. Fun if that's what you're looking for, but it can be loud and crowded. We were awakened on two nights by yelling and loud noises from the hall or the terrace. Probably not the fault of the hotel but if you're a light sleeper, you may go home tired. Neither the room nor the bathroom have much storage so if you like to unpack and put out your make up, hair products, etc. in the bathroom, you're going to have to improvise. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: JL5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at tower 23 for 5 nights in march with two very young children (ages 2 and 9 months). Our stay was fantastic. I was concerned that it may not be a kid friendly hotel but I could not have been more wrong. The kids loved the tower deck and being able to walk right out to the boardwalk and beach. The staff was very friendly, helpful and great with the kids. The roms were very clean and comfortable. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night which was excellent. Overall we had a great stay with the family and will be back. My only complaint is that we asked for a good Mexican restaurant recommendation. Jeremiah at the front desk recommended Cafe Coyote. It was awful! Do not go to this restaurant. The food tasted more like fast food then good Mexican. Tower 23 should not be recommending this restaurant to guests. The old town area in general was very tourist...I would not recommend spending time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JayTee80
Reviews.Content: We went here for our 1st wedding anniversary and man, I think I screwed up. I have no idea how I'm going to top this one. I booked this through this great deal on Luxury Link that included breakfast for 4 days, dinner for 2 one night, 2 cocktails and a bottle of champagne. Everyone was great...from valet to room service to the front staff. Upon arrival... Omar greeted us and said he was upgrading our already great room to the sweet suite...and sweet it was! Two huge rooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 balconies with ocean views. The bed was amazing the dinner at the restaurant was one of the best fine dining experiences ever. Location was close to everything. I could go on and on about this hotel...but you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with amazing views and the best service!”
Reviews.Author: Nokush
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my kids for three nights. Loved the hotel... The service is amazing...the staff is all about helping! The sunsets are Amazing. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms are spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: soccertravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in Feb as part of extended business trip. Friends reco'd t23 and we ran with it. Great choice. Location was great, every drink, app, meal was great, setting and facilities were great. Sun deck was fantastic for drinks and sunsets... Staff was friendly and engaging. All around really great.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location”
Reviews.Author: jsoxy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Tower 23 in January 2012. The location is spectacular....the sunsets are so beautiful. We had a surf pad with a great view. The beds are extremely comfortable, and there are several different pillows to choose from. The staff was very helpful, and the maid service timely and thorough. The bar and restaurant were busy the night we went down there, and the service was horrible, so we didn't stay to eat dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Ocean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTG_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at T23 for a week in early January and it was a great experience. A room overlooking the ocean with balcony couldn't be beat. The first room had an annoying electrical hum and they cheerfully moved us the next day to another room. Overall excellent service and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “T23 = One of our favorite hotels in the WORLD”
Reviews.Author: DallasFlysolofemme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tower 23 for over a week in November 2010 (I had to check March 2011 because I waited too long to write this review). This hotel is so cool, a famous indie rock band stayed in our same room the same week. Location: RIGHT ON THE BEACH. The sunsets were out of this world. We were addicted to the sunsets from our room at T23...we raced to the hotel to see them. JRDN: This restaurant is truly gourmet--and at a hotel. We shared 4 dinners at JRDN over the course of the week. We knew our waiters by name. The food was OUTSTANDING. Best oysters I've ever had--we compare all other oysters to the ones we had at JRDN. Room service: Room service was interesting because it wasn't just a room service delivery--it was like the restaurant came to you. We had loads of delicious breakfast foods included in our room rate. Every bit was executed with perfection. They were prompt and we loved our server, Meredith. And Josh--well, there were 2 Josh's. All were so much fun. Room: The products--OMG, the products!!! I can still smell them when I think back to Tower 23. The balmy lotion was my favorite. Seriously awesome products. The mini bar was well stocked, there were loads of snacks, and even souvenirs you could buy from the room. The robes were a good weight and we wore them a lot. The bed was enormous with tons of fluffy pillows. Chaise lounge was handy and comfortable. We loved our balcony, too. Nice sized closet and great TV. Service: I've mentioned the service was perfection. We were on first name basis with so many of our servers by the end of the trip. Do yourself a favor--stay at Tower 23. The vibe is unique and this place will make your trip to San Diego. It's worth going to San Diego JUST to stay at this hotel. Enchanting location for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sandman77
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at Tower 23 on 1/22/12-1/28/12. I have been to San Diego before, and the area that this hotel sits in usually has a lot of students coming in to party. I was traveling with my family and I did not know what to expect. Fortunately, Tower 23 was able to dispell some of my worries. We arrived and our room was spottless, and they brought our bags up promptly. We stayed in a ocean-view room on the 3rd floor. Our balcony opened up to the main patio, but it seemed to be sound proofed really well. Even when the patio was full we were never disturbed. Housekeeping did a great job. Valet was always on point, we never had an issue getting our vehicle. The employees were great with my son also, which was a big plus! Tower 23 sits on a great beach, with a spectacular view. Sunsets are amazing from the pier. There are plenty of restaurants around the property. Try Kono's for breakfast. You get a big breakfast for a reasonable price. Make sure you bring cash, because they don't take credit. Also try Narraya's Thai Cuisine and Fillippe's Pizzaria, they have great pizza! They also have the usuals around like IHOP and Denny's, that are in walking distance. La Jolla is not far away, and they have good places to eat there too. Mission Beach is close also, try Olive Cafe for breakfast, you won't regret it. You also can take Grand Ave to I-5 to go back into town to check out the Gaslamp District or go east to the fashion district, or to University. San Diego is a great town, and Tower 23 gave us another place to consider when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the place you're looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Seth M
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to stay here, and now I know why. I've been to SD/PB dozens of times, this was the best, period. Let's start with the staff, very accommodating and helpful in every way(Jerimiah especially). Made sure we were happy with our room, which was full ocean view(I highly recommend this). The views are amazing. We woke up one morning to see dolphins playing about 250 ft out from the shore, my wife was in total disbelief. The Tempurpedic bed assured us 8-10 hrs of rest every night, unreal. Rooms are good size, well executed in style, and you will get too comfortable, we didn't want to leave. We are very critical of the places we stay and have found nothing to have any issue with here. The Tower23 is now the only place we will be staying for now on. We came home feeling relaxed and refreshed, isn't that what a vacation should do? Do yourself a favor, stay here, you will not be sorry. To the Tower23, thanks, we needed that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel + great service”
Reviews.Author: LAdesigner101
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a Jetsetter Promotion for my friend's birthday. We stayed one night and wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms are exceptionally nice, with nice touches like plush robes, H2O plus bath goodies and tempurpedic queen/king beds. As a special treat, the hotel left gourmet chocolates for my friend's birthday! We got a nice third floor room, but due to the great design of the hotel, all of the rooms we saw looked nice. The restaurant downstairs is a bit pricy, but great for drinks! What a lucky find!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in PB - Hands Down (Must Get 'Surf Pad' To Fully Enjoy)”
Reviews.Author: katensteve
Reviews.Content: I lived in PB for many years before moving away and was looking for a nice hotel in the area when my husband and I came back for a friend's wedding. Tower 23 is hands down the best hotel in the area - it is luxurious, extremely modern and literally looks out onto the beach with stunning views of the water and sunset everyday. That being said - you HAVE to get yourself a Surf Pad to fully enjoy the views. The other rooms look out onto a court yard which is nice - but by no means has the amazing views that the hotel offers with their Surf Pads. I was worried that it would be very noisy in the room due to this being one of the trendier spots in town (downstairs bar/eatery), but we never had a problem with noise. The rooms are a good size, so are the bathrooms. Tower 23 is also near a TON of things in PB if you're looking to explore the area - from bike rental, to literally steps from the beach, to stores, food and bars all within walking distance. I will say that the valet was slow - so either look for street parking (it exists) or call down for your car every time.

Reviews.Title: “no better place on earth”
Reviews.Author: tnewbill
Reviews.Content: My adult family has stayted at Tower 23 5 times over the last 4 years our son has lived in PB. It is consistantly a 5 star hotel. No better place to stay in San Diego, La Jolla area. Great views and the restaurant is also a class establishment. Don't stay anywhere else when in the area

Reviews.Title: “Jeremiah went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen G
Reviews.Content: We went here over NYE weekend, and we had such a wonderful experience! The front desk supervisor, Jeremiah, was awesome. You could tell he really cares about the customers' needs. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends and I am definitely going to stay here anytime I'm in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean view but that's about it...EXTREMELY overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Missdaisybear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for NYE and my birthday. The hotel labels itself as a four star luxury lifestyle hotel and I will assure you it is not. The food, the view, and one friendly staff member were the only positives. We arrived wearing sweatpants after traveling all day to be greeted by a valet asking " are you here for dinner?". I believe it was more than obvious we were there to stay. True, my husband and I are young ( 25 and 26) but i think it was assumed we were just local young party people rather than guest paying 1100+ for a 3 night stay. We then arrived to our room. Absolutely wonderful view however furniture appears very Ikea like and the shower ran water all over the floor. Bed was very comfortable however and room was kept very clean. We did receive one bottle of Champagne complimentary for our anniversary and a second was sent Up by family with roses for my birthday which was very nice. However, after receiving these 2 bottles of Champagne and a 3rd to the room for NYE, we were carded by 3 different people before being allowed to be seated at our dinner reservation! The same people that had checked Us in and sent up champagne made my husband walk back up to our room to get my ID, then issued us a wristband. Even with the wristband now in place , a bouncer then came to ask us again for identification. Finally , the hostess seating us asked if we had our wristbands and if we were of age. I understand there are rules/ laws However there is a point where it is just rude. Finally, we were in and out of the hotel multiple times over our stay and other than check im and check out never received so much as a "hello" from the front desk staff standing right beside the elevator. From other experience, I would say friendly and respectful greeting and treatment of guests is something that helps to make a place a "luxury lifestyle" hotel. If you are young and looking for a truly luxurious stay and not o be treated like a local partier, this is not for you. Will most definitely opt For La Jolla or Coronado for our next visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean View and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: MonBon7
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay at a hotel with a wonderful Pacific Beach ocean view in San Diego, CA, Tower23 is the place to be! The hotel and rooms have a very contemporary flair. The full bar looks out onto the beach as you catch the beautiful sunset (don't forget to catch one of their delicious Chili Mango Margaritas). The romantic terrace off the 2nd floor boasts comfortable lounging, soft overhead twinkle lighting, a waterfall and cozy fire pit. In the evenings, there is staff to wait on you. Tower23's location is very convenient to local shops, bars, restaurants, etc. all within walking distance. There is parking in the garage (for a fee of $20 per night) for your convenience. I didn't give 5 stars for the following reasons: The hotel seems to cater to a younger crowd (20's to mid 30's) but not really family friendly. The air-conditioner must be goverened during the night, as it does not cool as much (and we like it cold when sleeping). There is no coffee pot in the room. The extra chaise lounge, although it looks good and fits with the modern decor has to be one of the most uncomfortable chairs I've ever sat in. The bathroom has very little counter space (enough for a man's hygeine products but hardly enough for a woman).

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL OVERLOOKING THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. it is right on the boardwalk in pacific beach san diego califorina. T he hotel is contempory and the room are very unique. Walking distance to resturants and shops. we will . stay her again.P.S. very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “The peferfect hotel for our perfect beach wedding”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: From top to bottom we could not have had a better experience having our wedding at Tower23. Every single person who was there was blown away by the beautiful setting, the great service and the amazing food. All of our out of town guests stayed at the hotel (44 rooms) so we pretty much had the run of the entire hotel on Saturday. Everyone loved their rooms, I think every one has at least a partial ocean view. The courtyard/ sunset deck area was perfect for the wedding, but was also great for family and friend to congregate over the course of the weekend. It will be a day we will remember for the rest of our lives and I cannot thank them enough for going out of the way to make it so special.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Tower23 for a few days while working down in that area, everything was amazing. The staff was great, the food and drinks were amazing and the view from your room is stunning. If you're looking for something upscale, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Most awesome hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Leigh ann H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were blessed to have stayed at Tower23 for our honeymoon for 7 days! The staff is amazing...always polite and extremely helpful!! I have never stayed in a place with such excellent service! The staff at Tower23 was sooo amazing that they truly made us feel that we were their only guests! Tower23 also has great food and breathtaking views of the ocean! My husband and I are planning to re-visit on our one year anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Place to Stay on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: My girl and I make it San Diego every year at least twice a year. I discovered T23 when it was a pile of sand next to the ocean. I knew I had to come back and check it out and we have been staying there ever since! Awesome view of the ocean and beachcombers. Great staff and lux bar. JRDN has great food and serivce. Im always looking for cool hip places to stay in SD but there is none better than T23.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beachfront hotel with luxurious surf-attitude!”
Reviews.Author: DavyVermeire
Reviews.Content: Super 'spiffy'! Tower23 has a cool vibe and great restaurant! Stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. Location is very good (on the beach) , only 15mins drive from downtown San Diego and near all major 'thing-to-do'. The room was very clean, big and spacious, very good and large bathroom,... Staff helpful and friendly. Quick valid parking, good roomservice, and nice design... no negative points on this hotel, only very positive points and even better memories. You have to try the restaurant: delicious! Tower 23 is my favourite hotel and restaurant in San Diego! Will come back because of the design, surf-vibe, friendly staff, restaurant, location and easy-going atmosphere. An excellent beachfront hotel with a luxurious surf-attitude in one of the coolest cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Pacific Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mljc68
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Tower 23. Great location, right on the beach, EXCELLENT restaurant. We had booked our 4 night stay through luxurylink.com and it included breakfast every morning and one dinner. When we got there, they gave us nice personalized vouchers detailing exactly what was included in our deal. The hotel restaurant/lounge was awesome; rather than go elsewhere, we would have drinks, snacks and lunch there because the food (and service) was amazing. The room itself was pretty bare, white walls and minimal decor but was very spacious with a great bathroom (separate shower and tub). The hotel was quiet when we were there altough the upstairs patio area does get busy in the afternoon (with lots of people "reserving" chairs by leaving their stuff there for hours!). I’m glad we stayed here rather than downtown… Pacific Beach is a very interesting area with lots of great shopping, restaurants, boardwalk, etc. We're hoping to return to Tower 23 because I can’t think of a single thing that would have made our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KarlPCalgaryAB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would never have even known about this hotel had it not been for a hotel mishap in Seattle. Long story short - she has a form of neuropathy that makes it impossible to sleep on a bad mattress. Trying to find a better hotel bed in Seattle eventually led to the discovery of a list of hotels in the US that offer Tempurpedic memory foam mattresses. This list led to our discovery of Tower 23 in Pacific Beach, or 'PB' as it's known by the locals. Our first visit to this little boutique hotel was in February 2011. It was a short visit, but the impression it left on us convinced us to come back for another, longer visit in September 2011. Let me state right up front, this hotel is not for everyone. It doesn't have a pool - this will turn some people off right away. We didn't care. We didn't come to San Diego to swim in a hotel pool. I've read other reviews on this hotel and noticed a few complaints about the homeless folks who pass by on the beachfront walkway. Pacific Beach has homeless people. You just can't get around that fact. We didn't find it intrusive or offensive in any way. They did not camp out near our hotel. On to what we liked. The bed, of course. If only every hotel had quality, memory foam mattresses, our trip planning would be so much easier and offer so many other choices. A definite win for Tower 23. The restaurant (JRDN) is great. Depending on the time of year, you can get breakfast there, but lunch and dinner are year-round and of high quality. One thing to be aware of when booking a room is that about half of the beach-facing rooms are directly over the restaurant / bar area. The restaurant has an outdoor patio as well and this place can get noisy when it's crowded. Weekend nights are worst. From our room on the third floor at the south end of the hotel, it wasn't too bad. We got a beach-front room and loved it. Being lulled to sleep by the sound of the surf is my idea of heaven. The bathroom is modern and well appointed. Nice big shower and a wonderful tub. The water runs into the tub from the ceiling, which is a little disconcerting at first, but it's OK. Just don't stand next to the tub for the first minute, or you'll get splashed. But it is a great tub. The rain shower is a nice touch. Tower 23 may not have a pool, but they do have a nice Sky Deck, a second floor outdoor deck overlooking the beach with lounge chairs and sofas and a fireplace for night-time. It's a popular spot and is often full of sunbathers in the afternoon. If you have a car, you may as well splurge on the $20 per day valet parking. Taking a chance to find parking on the street is taking a big risk, as the neighbourhood is very popular and I found it almost impossible to find parking near the hotel. It's just easier with the valet. I particularly love the location of the hotel, because you're right on the ocean, minutes from trendy La Jolla, a short drive from Fashion Valley Mall and easy access to the freeways that get you all around the San Diego area and up the coast to towns like Encinitas and Del Mar. We saved some money not renting a car at the airport and getting one in PB. So we're very glad we found this hotel. It is our new home whenever we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: jeanne452
Reviews.Content: We spent the week at Tower23 recently with friends from college. In looking for a hotel in the San Diego area, we wanted something on the beach and Tower 23 fit the bill. It is in a terrific location overlooking Pacific Beach. Rooms were immaculate, beds were comfortable, the staff was friendly, and the firepit, lounge area was great. Valet parking attendants were efficient and helpful (tip - use the free parking coupon from Trip Advisor). When we had a problem with our air conditioning that could not easily be remedied, we were upgraded to another room. Jeremiah and his staff took good care of us. The only problem was the weather did not cooperate and although we were there for a week, never saw a beautiful sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Tower 23”
Reviews.Author: blackshirtbill
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Tower 23 located on Pacific Beach in San Diego. Room with view of ocean exceptionally nice. Bar and restaurant excellent but fairly expensive. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Sunsets and Cool-ish Design but over all a little eh”
Reviews.Author: cjthekid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the tower23 for work and liked it. The design of the overall hotel is pretty cool, a glass box over looking the ocean. Our room however was a big eh. I did not see the other rooms but based on the lowest priced room they're not really worth the price they are asking. The room itself is fine with a nice little balcony...unfortunately the balcony faces other people's rooms. They call it a courtyard view...but in actuality it's more like a voyeurs view. Our room abutted up another's balcony....enough so that their cigar smoke came into our room. Noise travels as well. If you craned your neck out the window you could see the ocean. The service, while friendly, was a little lax. When we arrived to check in (after a long flight) there was a gentlemen in front of us asking silly questions for what seemed like forever. There was only one person at the front desk, and instead of calling for help or answering questions while checking us in...we waited 10 minutes to check in. Clearly there should be a concierge person and a check in person...not just one person. We also returned home to find the valet parking closed at 10pm on saturday night. The gate was down. We came down to hang out on the deck in the afternoon, only to find no cushions or anywhere to sit. We had to run around to the front desk and get security to come open it. That's a little strange. All of these little glitches are understandable but at the price they were charging should not have happened. This is clearly a smallish design hotel but that doesn't mean they have to be small on service. That being said, the sunsets from this location are absolutely stunning. All in all I wouldn't discount a stay at the Tower23 but I can't say it's worth it for the cheapest room. If you want to stay at the beach then pony up the cash for the direct ocean view rooms. If not just grab drink there and watch the sun set.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View of the Ocean!”
Reviews.Author: Thea B
Reviews.Content: My room was amazing - it was clean, spacious, and my bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. Room service was fantastic - love the french toast! The Front Desk Supervisor, Jeremiah, was such an incredibly nice person. The entire staff, including the cleaning people, were great. Thanks so much - I will definitely stay here when I visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: LNarvaezMD
Reviews.Content: This is the most modern hotel in Pacific Beach, totally upscale compared to any other we walked by. It is on the beach, we had a king-size ocean view, glad we upgraded! Went for my birthday, had reservations at JRDN, wonderful restaurant with a bar overlooking the ocean, we just enjoyed the whole day and night at the hotel! The service was great, loved the check-in with a nice complimentary drink to start a wonderful stay. Everyone knew it was my b-day, enjoyed the attention. On arrival a nice message was sent to our room and a birthday card to boot! When we came back from dinner, a nice surprise was waiting, thank you so much for a wonderful stay, we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel, definitely my place for the next visits to San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Goeres
Reviews.Content: An excellent cold, in concrete and cool architecture. A fabulous view! Direct on the Beach! Excellent with Kids! Quit! Top Service! $20 unlimited valet parking (and the the TipAdvisor Coupon ;-)) Get an room with access to the terrace where you will enjoy the fireplace and the view over the Pacific Ocean at night (do not forget to get a glass of wine form the bar;-)) If you want to get local ambiance take breakfast next do at Konos

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel on Pacific Beach, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: OverSeaOverLand
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 is a nice boutique hotel right on Pacific Beach. Service was great with friendly staff. We were offered complimentary cocktails on arrival, which made us feel welcome. The room was lovely, with a great bed and lovely bathroom. We had an ocean view room, which was right on the front of the hotel with direct beach views 20 yards in front of us. You can watch the people go past and surfers catching the waves early morning and early evening. Hotels offers wifi, although there was no signal in the room I stayed in. Hotel might need to check strength of signal throughout whole hotel. I got reception in the lovely communal area which has decking lounger chairs and a great little fire to provide additional heat in the evening. Hotel offers it own "business centre" with a PC and printer, which was quite old and think they need to upgrade to a new model. Very sllllow connection, think PC more than 3 years old. You can valet your car at the hotel, costs $20 a night. The hotel has it's own restaurant and bar, with amazing changing light on the wall. Brilliant interior deco. Got the impression this hotel is where the locals come out to sample the great food and nice atmosphere at the bar as well. Would recommend Tower23, felt really relaxing and got the true Californian beach experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing. Everything about it was fantastic-the views-the staff-the restaurant. We can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: lillabye
Reviews.Content: Work and so many pressures made it mandatory to take a two day break. Pacific Beach is a fantastic location and this hotel is the TOPPPSSS!!! We are used to great places, but this hotel outdid many of the great ones we have stayed at. Directly on the ocean and the ocean walk, the views are spectacular, and our "sweet suite" was truly wonderful. It was beautifully equipped and furnished with views to die for. The bed is one of the most comfortable we've ever experienced in a hotel. Even the little things (like the soap) were amazing...and the whirl-pool bathtub...spectacular. But two things really stood out. Every person on the staff we met was excellent, from the maintenance guys to the front office folks, to the garage folks and the cleaning people. We had an amazing dinner at the showplace restaurant JRDN, and it was one of the best meals in recent memory, including some many starred places in NYC. Service was superb, personal...not overdone...just perfect. All in all this was a truly wonderful break!

Reviews.Title: “Great beachside respite”
Reviews.Author: KI6871
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Sky Pad for three nights chillaxing after a Vegas visit. Hotel room was best described as cosy with a kind of Brady Bunch timber feel about it yet somehow it all worked really well. A tad overpriced but we were 'walk ins' and it was Summer vacation by the water so I guess you've got to expect that. Aircon was a tad frustrating as it turned on and off and was quite noisy. $20 unlimited valet parking was fabulous. The rooftop terrace and open fire is a perfect way to finish off a relaxing day by the Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in PB, sexy, fun and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: statey
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, I love the bar, I love the location, I love the rooms, I love the views. I have been here so many times and will continue! Even when I was a walk in last minute, I LOVE this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff in a convenient and popular location”
Reviews.Author: aaronmisha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our trip to Tower 23 and San Diego! The room(Surf Pad) and view were fantastic! All of the staff members were extremely pleasant to work with. Jeremiah, the front desk supervisor, offered lots of great advice on cool dining experiences, which was truly appreciated. The JRDN staff was also a very pleasant crew, which is tough to find in many tourist locations. Overall, our experience at Tower 23 was amazing. Our only complaint would be the popularity of the location, we would have enjoyed something a little more peaceful. If your looking for a great place to stay with an awesome restaurant and convenient beach front location, Tower 23 is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Cute "boutique" hotel”
Reviews.Author: LYKTraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last year during Labor Day weekend. I had found some cheaper and nice hotels in Gaslamp but he wanted to pay a little more and stay right on the beach. Out of all the hotels we looked at in that area, this looked to be the nicest one. It's a small hotel right in front of the beach. The room was a good size with nice bathrooms. We wanted a king sized bed, but we ended up with two queens instead. I think the regular rooms only come with two queens instead of one king. They have a deck area at the hotel (second floor?) where you can lay out, order food/drinks, and see a nice view of the beach and watch people walk by. I thought they had a pool based on some pictures, but it's just a small little water feature. We ordered some drinks and appetizers and it was fine. Their restaurant always looked like a hip, happening spot for happy hour and early nights, but we always went out to different bars and try different restaurants in the area, so I don't really have a review on the scene at night and whether the food was good. Overall, the staff were very pleasant and it is a nice hotel, certainly the nicest by the beach. It is a little pricey but that is to be expected given the contemporary and "sleek" look that they have going on. I wish they had a pool though, as it would have made it more worth it. I stayed here a year ago but nothing negative or overly positive really sticks out about the place. If I were going back to San Diego and wanted to stay by the beach, I would stay here again though since we didn't really have a negative experience. It is a very basic hotel with no spa, pool, or fitness center so if you are someone who likes all the extra amenities at a hotel, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: yoannrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night there at the end of July and really appreciated the hotel and service. Also the night I eat at the restaurant and the food was great really recommend to try the bison steak. Concerning the wine it would be good to have a few Rose wines in the menu, best wine to enjoy the summer with either meat or fish. For sure I will come back next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation”
Reviews.Author: tucazdz
Reviews.Content: We booked a sex on the beach package. From the moment we arrived the service was spectacular. The staff is extremely helpful and courteous. The location is amazing. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oceanbluela
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend my birthday by the sea and had something very specific in mind. Right on the water, modern, beautiful, low key, and excellent service. Living in Los Angeles (and 20 minutes from Malibu), I am somewhat spoiled by close by seaside activities and options. My partner and I were tempted by many options within an hour or two drive. But after reading about Tower 23 and seeing the photos and reviews, we decided to head to Pacific Beach. I am so happy we did. The hotel is beautiful... light and airy and cool. The room was large and the bed was unreal... so soft and dense. The pillows were heaven. It was quiet with no noise from the rooms on either side. The restaurant was perfect. We had lunch one day and breakfast the next, both enjoyed at an outside table looking at the surfers and waves. The prices were extremely reasonable and the food very good. The service there was also a 10. My partner and I are very picky when we travel, and we travel a lot and prefer to stay in 5 star hotels. This hotel passed every test. We will definitely return for that little vacation two hours down the coast. Stay there... you'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best experience I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: cwagener
Reviews.Content: We booked through Luxury Link, we had a great package that included breakfast, parking, one free night of dinner at JRDN and 2 free cocktails at the bar. We stayed in the Sanctuary Suite. The room was AMAZING. I am a nurse, so I am very picky about cleanliness and germs. I check the beds, pillows, shower, toilet, etc everywhere I go. NEVER has a hotel been so PERFECT. I mean it. PERFECT. Everyday they cleaned and it was meticulous. I could not have done better myself. Every room had an ocean view. Did I mention the color therapy hot tub in my room - and the water to fill it came from the ceiling!! It was amazing! The staff was so friendly and accommodating and the location!! OMG - right on the beach, beautiful view, wonderful sun deck (with bar service)... Walk to the beach, walk to starbucks (but why - there is a complimentary Kerig in the lobby!), walk to shopping - I will be back. Tower23 WOWed me in a way that I have never been WOWed before.

Reviews.Title: “Tower23 was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: sourcegatekeeper
Reviews.Content: I hate Trip Advisor as a website but our service so absolutely excellent I had to hop online and make sure that anyone searching for Tower 23 sees this. Jeremiah was the best concierge I could ever ask for. Awesome ideas, awesome service, Amazing room, seriously couldn't ask for much more. Thank you Tower23, and seriously give Jeremiah kudos for me!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant in every way”
Reviews.Author: Duster4260
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise 50th birthday. When we arrived Nati and Jeremiah greeted us with warm smiles, quick registration and a complimentary cocktail. When they heard it was a special weekend, Jeremiah got us situated for the evening with a reservation at the hotel restaurant, which I will tell you now has amazing food. The hotel is a modern boutique style. Perfect for a couples get away. We had a partial view on the North side 2nd floor which gave us a view of people on the boardwalk and the sunsets over the ocean. Both very entertaining. We were in the room no more than 20 minutes when a knock on the door came. A plate of wonderful brownies with rasberries and a happy birthday card was delivered by John (also smiling!) as a gift from the hotel. The restaurant also provided creme brulee as a birthday gift and tasty treat at the end of our meal. Try a sampling of the oysters... they are great, as are the scallops. In the mornings, you coffee/tea drinkers will love the Keurig in the lobby. We also recommend running just next door to Kona's for breakfast, but be sure to eat it on their "hidden" deck right above the beach. Even though we did the running to the zoo and sea world, it was great to come back to Tower23 early each day. There is no having to walk to get to the beach -- you're on it! The valet service is quick and friendly. Jeremiah, at the front desk always so it seemed, is a great resource and help. We didn't use this, but I heard him helping another couple with bike rentals. If you are on the street side, you do get some noise, but it was very entertaining for us. The bed is extremely comfortable and the shower is perfect for couples. If you want to stay in the heart of this beach community and want something a little special, then Tower23 is it.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: TolisDiablo
Reviews.Content: I visited for my first time San Diego and my gf and I picked this hotel mainly for the location. Tower 23 has everything a modern hotel can offer. Nothing special or extraordinary but enough to make your stay enjoyable. Staff was very helpful, restaurant and bar were great as well. The view from our balcony is all the money. Finally the bed is one of the most comfortable I ve ever slept!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lexie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two non-consecutive nights on either end of a trip to Ensenada for the Baja 500. We booked a room without an ocean view since we weren't going to be here long enough to hang out, but when we arrived they upgraded us to an ocean view room. The room is modern, clean, and soothing. There is a comfy chaise lounger in the room that is very comfy to lounge on. The bed is like sleeping in a cloud with lots of pillows and a comforter. The AC works well and the shower has good pressure and is roomy. The view was beautiful, and the hotel is literally right on the boardwalk. We ate at the hotel restaurant which was amazing. The food was great, and we ate outside where the temperature was perfect, and the view was fantastic with lots of people and pet watching. They have valet parking and a garage. On our return stay we had a room without the ocean view, but it was just as nice. The only differences were instead of a shower stall we had a shower/tub combo and the view. Now the view was not of the ocean but it was interesting. Our room had sliding glass doors that looked right out onto the hotel's patio. It was a little disconcerting to have people right there while we were in our room. I think the windows were probably tinted and once the sun went down we closed the curtains so it wasn't a problem, it was just odd. The night of our second stay we walked down the boardwalk to World Famous. The food was really good, and we got to see the Fire Lane guys put on their fire juggling show as we were leaving. Everyone whom we dealt with from the front desk to the valet was super friendly and helpful. The proximity of the hotel to the beach/boardwalk, the room comfort, and the friendliness of the staff make this a place we will choose to return to when we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: SunnyAZ24
Reviews.Content: Thank you for your excellent customer service! Our stay was wonderful!! The food was delicious, all of the staff was great, and the view was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: calilove16
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this hotel in September of 2009 but I'm just getting around to writing the review. I found this hotel by researching online, it was our first time in San Diego together and I wanted to treat my fiance to a nice hotel stay on the beach for his birthday. We got there a little early and our room wasn't ready so they put us in another room that was better, it was a corner room and had AMAZING views of the beach. The room was awesome, the bathroom was unbelievable, water came out of the ceiling into the bathtub!!! We enjoyed one of the best meals we've ever had at JRDN restaurant that is downstairs, I recommend it to anyone that is going to San Diego. We also enjoyed an room service for breakfast the next morning which we enjoyed on our balcony listening to the ocean breeze. While we were there we did the private surfing lessons that the hotel set up for us which were awesome. Honestly I can't say enough good things about this hotel, we're planning to make a stop for our honeymoon when we head out west next year. The only thing that's missing is a swimming pool, but you're literally on the beach so how can you complain.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: the_perfect_h0liday
Reviews.Content: Tower23 is amazing! We stayed in a surf pad inter connecting room with our 2 children (ages 10,14). The rooms are a good size with excellent bathrooms. We all loved this hotel, the staff are all so friendly & welcoming, the rooms are fantastic & the view looking out from our balcony was spectacular!!! We had dinner at the restaurant one night, food & staff were great & it had a really good feel about it. Pacific Beach is such a cool place. We hired cruisers from the bike shop across the road & rode for hours along the boardwalk. A must also is Kono's right next door to Tower23. Great food for litle cost, again really nice people & great location. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- GREAT Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Coop31
Reviews.Content: When a family friend told us they were celebrating their birthday in the restaurant at Tower 23 Hotel, my husband and I figured we would get a room there for the night. From the second we pulled into the very chic hotel the Valet greeted us with a smile and offered to call the Bellman for our luggage. Sarah greeted us at the front desk. Her kind demeanor was refreshing, opposed to some "snooty" hotels where you feel as though they are pushing you through the doors to your room. Sarah told us all about the hotel, restaurant and offered a place where we could rent bikes. The hotel room was very comfortable and amazingly clean. Our room looked out to the ocean. If I had a strong arm, I probably could have thrown a rock onto the sand…that is how close we were to the ocean. The restaurant had delectable food and a good crowd. Happy hour is very reasonable, and the sunset view is literally breathtaking. Our server Jayton was easy going yet professional. We followed dinner with a night cap on the Tower Deck, where a fire pit paired with the nice ocean breeze defined paradise. In the morning we ordered room service for breakfast. Meredith brought a ray of sunshine into our room along with her. She not only delivered our delicious breakfast, but also made some really good recommendations of places to go in the area. Overall our Tower 23 experience was nothing short of perfection. I would HIGHLY recommend anyone stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service wow...and amazing boutique hotel....”
Reviews.Author: michaelmarisa
Reviews.Content: Total value and modern hotel.....great great service...a must if in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great getwawy trip with wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuglove83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to have "date night" and chose Tower23. We live in San Diego but wanted the feeling of getting away. The hotel is overlooking the beach and the views are gorgeous. Its very close to Garnet Ave, which is the party heartbeat of Pacific Beach. The staff is very nice and attentive. I didnt have a chance to eat at the restaurant but I've heard wonderful things from co-workers. They swear by the blueberry mojitos. The room was spacious and I loved the bathroom. We had a spa which was amazing! The water came down from the ceiling and the spa had controllers that made the water warmer, controlled the pressure on the jets and changed the color of the water. The bed was very comfortable with a number of pillows to choose from. The patio area overlooked the courtyard and the beach. A great way to start the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but a very good experience.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: I researched a number of hotels for my weekend away in San Diego. I was looking for a luxury, upscale hotel that was on the beach, yet close to late-opening bars and night life. It was quite hard to find this. A lot of the resorts are either on the bay or miles from anything. Tower 23 is a modern, small and recently refurbished hotel in a prime location. It's right on Pacific Beach and has wonderful views from its terrace and bar/restaurant. It's a short walk away from a whole host of bars and restaurants in the casual Pacific Beach neighborhood. A cab to the classier Gaslamp district was $35 (in general I felt the taxis were very expensive in San Diego). The staff were mostly all excellent and tried hard to help us have a good stay. On the first night, the hotel manager made an exception to hotel policy by turning on the fire-pit on the roof for us. It was appreciated and he didn't have to do that. Another staff member brought blankets out for us. The drinks service on the terrace was also good. The hotel's bar and restaurant is excellent. It has great views of the ocean, very good quality brunch and the ambiance is perfect. I noticed a lot of locals go there for special occasions - birthday parties or weekend nights out. I booked the Sanctuary Suite at the hotel. This room was first rate. It was spacious and modern with a wet bar and comfortable bed. The signature feature, however, was the giant spa bathtub with a tap in the ceiling that fills it. Colored lights and powerful jacuzzi jets also make for a relaxing soak. DOWN SIDE: My hotel suite was very expensive and for the money I have experienced far more. It's basically a Peninsula or Four Seasons rate without a resort that even comes close to those type of hotels. Tower 23 is nice and well run -- but it doesn't have the scale or world class service of a true luxury hotel. It's more of a well put-together local hotel with a modern edge. Aside from the expensive price, my only other disappointments were: -No hotel pool - surprising! -They couldn't give us a late check out, and the normal check out time is a rather early 11am Otherwise, a great, relaxing and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beachfront Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mwd05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spoiled ourselves with a night at Tower 23. We live in San Diego and have been to Tower 23 before for dinner and drinks but recently stayed the night and WOW was it worth it! The location is the best in San Diego - one of the few nice hotels on the beach. We also love the modern luxury design. Gorgeous view of the ocean and perfect for a stroll on the beach or an afternoon surfing. I would recommend an upgrade to a view room if possible! We had excellent service from all the staff. My favorite aspects of the room were the bed and the bathtub (loved the bath soaps & shampoos too). Also loved walking right out on the deck in the morning. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant JDRN and were really impressed with our dinner. Again excellent service and food! I had the scallops and my husband had the ribeye both were cooked perfectly and delicious. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any family or friends looking for a luxury getaway in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: 24shoregirl
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler, the quality of a hotel is very important to me. This is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location, the Pacific Beach area of San Diego. This is what you think old California must have been like. I expected to see the Beach Boys at any time. Great sunsets, beautiful beach and lots of surfers. The hotel is well managed, the staff was exceptional and the vibe is very laid back. I was comfortable and felt secure at all times. The room was upscale beach house, furnished very nicely with a small bathroom and a great tub.

Reviews.Title: “We will return.”
Reviews.Author: greekhula
Reviews.Content: Great customer service at front desk and throughout the Hotel. Elizabeth H. went above and beyond providing information on their killer lights. Loved our oceanfront room and Oysters at the bar. We will be returning next year and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Chelseaguy68
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler both for business and pleasure and the ocean front room at Tower 23 was one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. I frequently stay at the Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons so my standards and expectations are very high and I have to say that this hotel blew me away. First off, the ocean front rooms are only about 50 feet from the beach with direct views of the ocean with a front row seat to spectacular sunsets every night. The rooms have balconies that allow you to sip a nice glass of wine, read a magazine, and be treated to one of the best hotel views I have ever experienced. The decor of the room is fantastic too. It's modern, clean and stocked with a great mini bar, flat screen t.v. high end bath products, and a very comfortable bed. The hotel itself is small and there's no pool, but there is a super nice deck with lounge chairs, comfy sofas, fountains, and a fire pit. The restaurant and bar serve great food and the room service was divine: ahi tuna, grilled octopus, and oysters. This hotel is an absolute gem. I'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest bed I have ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHamster
Reviews.Content: We were on a big US road trip and went to PB in SD for sone 'down-time'. Unfortunately, despite it being September, we got rubbsh weather so being at this hotel was great. T23 is the best hotel in the PB area I'm sure of that. The restaurant is good - they do 1/2 price bottles of wine on a Tuesday which is worth taking advantage of -- and the rooms are so comfy. The beds are ridiculously comfortable. There is no pool - but you have the sea at arms length if you re feeling ballsy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but missed the mark to be GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: PackGuru
Reviews.Content: We just left Tower 23 this morning. We had a wonderful time on the beach and were looking forward to our 1st stay at the hotel. Check-in was great. We arrived early and they held our bags and called us when our room was available. We were in a Surf Pad on the 3rd floor rm. 321. Room was nice, but much of our view was obstructed with a palm tree. We were never able to get the internet to work, called the front desk, said they would look into the problem, but never did. Also called to see if they could send up a small mirror and was told she would try to locate one, again no phone call. Made reservations for JRDN to sit on the patio. When we arrived we were told that it would not be possible because they had large parties out there already. Just not what I expected from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach Hotel in SD”
Reviews.Author: Torben22
Reviews.Content: I was at the Tower23 Hotel last year on vacation. The hotel is perfect situated right next to the Beach. The Beach Front Room has a perfect view on the sea. The rooms could be a little bit bigger but absolutely ok for a few days. From here you can visit for example La Jolla...Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: alykeany
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Tower 23 Hotel for a staycation getaway. We chose this hotel so we could enjoy the beach atmosphere for the holiday weekend. The room we had was beautiful with a full ocean view. The rooms also had free wi fi internet and we loved that we could place an in room dining order the night before and they will deliver it at whatever time you request. We also had a delicious dinner at JRDN. We started off with the delicious mussels and enjoyed the rest of the meal. We all had a great time and cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: hookem22
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last year. We absolutely thought it was great. Staff was friendly the hotel bar/restaurant was great and it is in a great location. It does get pricey but what do you expect from a trendy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by a pretty high priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeus451
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an upscale, trendy type place in an obvious great location, however not a great value for the price. We were told by hotel staff prior to our booking that they were having a DJ/party for the 4th of July which turned out to not be the case. That was the major reason why we decided to stay there. While the rooms were nice, we had to let the shower run for about 20 minutes before we could get any hot water. Not something you want when you are paying over $400 a night. The staff did offer a $100 credit to us, but unfortunately that didn't make up for a lack-luster experience and a ruined 4th of July. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel for price of 3”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestBabies
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern rooms. Amazingly comfortable beds. Trendy bar/restaurant downstairs. Beautiful beach location. Perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel like an unwanted house guest...”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrvlr788
Reviews.Content: The views may be beautiful but you're definitely better off driving over to Pacific Beach from anywhere else in San Diego to enjoy them, rather than wasting your money on this trendy pit. Tower 23 touts itself as a four star - following our stay at the Four Seasons, I can assure you it is not. This hotel is an old Best Western with a fresh coat of paint and very poor service. The staff at this hotel made us feel like unwanted house guests. We were greeted by an apathetic valet that needed to be coaxed to remove our luggage from the trunk. The front desk people were nice enough but had no local info to offer us and never followed up when we asked. We asked for help getting a cab and the front desk wasn't able to accomplish this. After waiting 25 minutes, we had to go in, ask again, and make sure the front desk staff picked up the phone and actually dialed this time. There is no pool and the room amenities are low to none (no lotion at all.) The room was small and mediocre; the bed was uncomfortable and the sheets were rough. To top it off, we were kept up all night by the nightclub below us. Our complaints and request to check out later that night were answered with a "sorry, you booked here for three days, you can't check out." (WHAT?!) Never once was there any question as to why weren't happy or if there was anything the staff could do to improve our stay through the night. When we confronted the manager early the next morning and asked to be absolved of our three night check-in, we were told that, "The hotel is not for everyone and you are free to leave." We were prepared to list a number of reasons for our dissatisfaction, but we were never asked. There was no inquiry as to why we were displeased, any apology about our experience, or remorse at losing business. Defining yourself as a trendy, boutique hotel does not mean that you make your guests feel like an unwanted outsider... This hotel is a complete waste of time and money. We took off as soon as we could to the W downtown. My husband and I no longer speak of our 12-hour stay at Tower 23 - it was a dark time for us and we've tried to block it from our memory. However, I feel like one last acknowledgement of this experience is worthwhile if it saves at least one person from an experience like ours.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: traveler10011
Reviews.Content: stayed a few nights in june 2010 w teen son loved the hotel, excellent friendly staff clean spare modern rooms - great beds and beautiful bath ocean view w direct access to roof lounge by far the nicest property in the funky pacific beach town pacif beach is funky, not too upscale typical california town great place to spend a few days

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel - Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: azgoldtwh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and could have stayed the rest of the summer. Our room was so clean and kept that way throughout our stay. I had originally requested a 3rd floor room, but "Katy" gave us a 2nd floor room that was just FANTASTIC. The 3rd floor rooms have some view blockage from palm trees. We had the best room in the hotel.. Room 222, totally unobstructed view. I was not so sure when Katy told us she had given us a 2nd floor room, but after seeing the room, she was ABSOLUTELY right. We had direct access to the sun deck and the best view in the house... We ate 2 dinners at the hotel and the food was out of this world. RYAN & Jessie were a great help with our heater situation the second evening we ate at the hotel. The first evening, the waiter was less than concerned that I was cold. .. don't remember his name. We met Ryan the first evening meal and snagged him for help our second evening meal because he had been so nice to us the first evening. They could use a few more "portable" heaters on coolish evenings. The service was excellent both evening meals, except that the first evening I think they were a bit short of staff and the service was a little disjointed. The second evening more than made up for any deficiencies the first evening meal. Parking and hotel access was very easy. They could use a porter to help with luggage, but the management did provide assistance. We were a little confused whether we should have tipped the management for luggage assistance or not. We had previously read that sleeping at this hotel was difficult from the noise level. We didn't hear anything after we shut the arcadia doors. Our room was stone silent at night. I'm not a good sleeper, but my husband and I slept like "the dead" at this hotel. The beds & linens are just scrumptuous (sp?). If your looking for a romantic hotel on the beach with all the amenities of a 5-Star Hotel... Tower23 is for you! and ME!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jeno6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tower 23 in mid-April with my husband and baby. We absolutely loved it! The room was big, extremely clean, and had a fantastic view -- and we only had "partial" ocean view. The staff was super helpful and very friendly. Housekeeping was fantastic -- they even lined up my baby's toys in his crib each day! We were able to hook up to the free Wi-Fi from anywhere in the hotel - which my husband loved. The location was great, lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Overall, one of the best places we've stayed at. I have already recommended Tower 23 to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location - Stayed with the Family + Dog”
Reviews.Author: tskelton
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, service was awsome. Had a crib and roll-a-way bed in place for when we got there. Room was clean and modern, view of the ocean was great. The outside area was nice and comfortable. Was pet friendly but the pet fee at $75 was a little steep. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Rejuvenating”
Reviews.Author: centralvalleytravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Pacific Beach where we stayed at Tower 23 with another couple. We had the 2 corner rooms on the second floor. How can anyone ask for a better view ? We loved being able to watch the ocean and the sunset while sitting on our balcony with a glass of wine. The entire staff was the best ! Every question,every request is met with a smile and taken care of. We ate one night at the restaurant which is called JRDN. The food was outstanding ! If you like steak, I recommend this place. After dinner we all gathered on the second floor deck around the fire pit for drinks, what a fabulous way to end the day !! We loved the direct beach access and the whole atmosphere of this hotel. We are all over 50 and although we were there during the week the noise was not bad considering we were right above the the sidewalk and the bar. We have stayed here many times since the hotel opened and we will stay here everytime we are in the San Diego area. LOVE the ambience,the service and the location. It's fun and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: tourist13Uk
Reviews.Content: All that the Tower 23 Hotel has going for it is its location. Whilst the rooms were clean the decor and furniture was cheap and in need of a spruce up. It was impossible to get WiFi access anywhere in the hotel except for the bar! When we mentioned this to the reception we were told it was because the hotel was made of concrete! In addition the bathroom door offered very little privacy! Overall, a very overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fetter
Reviews.Content: Hi. I have recently been staying in the hotel tower23, and as always a super experience. I have been coming there for the last three year, because of the location, the ambience, and of course the great service. the service is very important for me, and it just gets better and better. Thanks guys, for a perfect stay, and for putting a big smile on my face! Love Chistian

Reviews.Title: “Tower 23 Part 2 of 2”
Reviews.Author: ghwk
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Tower 23 and was immediatly greeted by Lisa who confirmed that even though we were early that the room was available. Once checked in and back in the lobby we requested information regarding places to eat, where to find some music etc.. We were assisted by both Nancy and Lisa who within an hour had researched and printed up a list (with directions and phone numbers) of nearby places that were along the lines of what we were looking for. Both were very helpful and courteous and handeled our requests efficiently and with professionalism. The cleaning service was very good and our corner room view of the ocean excellent. The room itself was great, very comfortable, clean and with 2 queen beds and very comfortable linens and mattress. I would definately stay there again. Nancy and Lisa thank you so much for your hospitality and service!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: MontanaMissyRae
Reviews.Content: Reid and Sanaan were exceptional along with the rest of the very friendly staff. For full review, check out my blog: http://cultivate3f.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Mom and Daughter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: roxyandrews
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! This hotel is modern and clean and the staff are helpful and friendly. Its right on the boardwalk, walking distance to everything. We had a full ocean view which was spectacular and our room was spacious and perfect for just us two. My mom was woken up a few times by people drinking and partying on the deck, you would only hear them if you had a full ocean view and I slept through it. The restaurant is wonderful, but really expensive, movies are $16 and water is $8. We spent $100 on breakfast, because their wasn't prices attached. If you are splurging this place is so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on a cloud”
Reviews.Author: wizelliott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five days with our 18 and 21 year old daughters. We all loved it. This hotel is beautifully modern and decorated in a very "now" look. Fresh flowers, organic sculptures, high end finishes. Clean with very friendly and helpful staff in all parts of the hotel (front desk, parking valet, housekeeping, restaurant). This room with 2 Queen size beds was big enough for all of us. We had a problem with the toilet on the first day and it was fixed immediately while we were out. No more problems. The hotel has only 44 rooms and only three floors total. It's a nice size. It's in pristine physical condition. Our room was in the back of floor 3. Perfect. Do not be afraid of "partial ocean view" description. We could see the water from our room and in reality, you are either out on the Tower Deck (roof deck) or out on the beach or boardwalk most of the time anyway. Because we were in a room toward the back, "partial ocean view", we were set back from the wonderful (but noisy at night) restaurant and bar. If we had been in a room right out front on the water side, it might have difficult to sleep. As it was, our room was quiet and the beds are like sleeping on a cloud. I have to say we did miss the awesome breakfast served daily in the hotel restaurant, from previous visits. I believe in busier months, the breakfast will be served again daily. In the meantime, the most famous breakfast place in Pacific Beach, Konos, is just steps away and superfast and yummy. Enjoy Tower 23.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. The front desk staff was nice enough and the bar was rockin' when we arrived. Restaurant/bar area seems to be quite the place to party for the 20 somethings. Rooms are very clean and the Tempur-pedic beds are perfect! Our balcony opened up to the water and overlooked the tower deck. A delightful place. We'll recommend it and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: AustinMercy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I who Iive in Austin, TX went to San Diego for our son's lacrosse tournament and decided to stay on our own away from the team. Tower 23 is a "groovy" hotel RIGHT on the beach! Being an Interior Designer, I'm very particular about my accomodations and I have to say, I was not disappointed.
